intro: Jacquemontia montana, commonly known as the mountain Jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other climbing plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Jacquemontia montana is typically found growing in rocky or mountainous habitats at high elevations.
